body_html:
JUST change it.

with tf.gfile.Open(filename, 'r') as f:
data_dict = cPickle.load(f)
to
with open(filename, 'rb') as f:
data_dict = cPickle.load(f, encoding='bytes')

important thing is mode 'rb' and encoding='bytes'
If you working on some open sources, you will encounter additional errors about the variable type.
But the problems are easier to manage than this file open and encoding problem, so it's a good idea to fix this way.

I had done with in CIFAR 10 python code. which is:
https://github.com/dndusdndus12/models/tree/master/tutorials/image/cifar10_estimator
generate_cifar10_tfrecords.py

body:
JUST change it.

with tf.gfile.Open(filename, 'r') as f:
    data_dict = cPickle.load(f)
to
  with open(filename, 'rb') as f:
    data_dict = cPickle.load(f, encoding='bytes')

important thing is mode 'rb' and encoding='bytes'
If you working on some open sources, you will encounter additional errors about the variable type. 
But the problems are easier to manage than this file open and encoding problem, so it's a good idea to fix this way.

I had done with in CIFAR 10 python code. which is:
https://github.com/dndusdndus12/models/tree/master/tutorials/image/cifar10_estimator
generate_cifar10_tfrecords.py
